revised_title: Exploring the Connection between St. Lawrence Winds and Barometer Movements
tldr: The author, William Kelly, observed the relationship between the winds of the St. Lawrence River and the movements of the barometer over a period of fifteen years. Contrary to the general belief, he found that the barometer often rises with strong winds and that there is a steady connection between the winds and the barometer movements in the region. The valley of the St. Lawrence, surrounded by hills, plays a significant role in this connection.
